definition[0]: a part of a contract for a bond that allows the seller to buy back the bond early
example[0]: Before buying a bond, you should always ask your broker if there is a call provision and, if so, when and under what circumstances the bond can be called.
definition[1]: a part of a loan agreement that allows the lender to ask for payment of the full amount of the loan early, if payments have not been made, or if a business is not achieving expected results
example[1]: In recent years, a third of the value of small commercial loans have included a call provision.
